committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Europe and the Middle East

official_title: To provide OPIC insurance, reinsurance, and financing to eligible projects in Poland.

summary.text: Authorizes the Overseas Private Investment Corporation (OPIC) to issue insurance or reinsurance, guarantee loans, or extend financing for eligible investors with respect to projects in Poland only if such projects are undertaken in conjunction with the nongovernmental sector in Poland. Requires OPIC to annually certify to the Congress that businesses in Poland with respect to which OPIC has undertaken any such activities do not violate any internationally recognized workers' rights. Prohibits OPIC from undertaking any such activities with respect to any project in Poland: (1) which fosters unfair competition with import-sensitive U.S. industries or leads to significantly adverse impacts on U.S. employment; or (2) until the Secretary of State has certified that the Government of Poland has enacted laws which significantly improve the operating conditions for private enterprises in Poland, including the reform of present conditions governing joint ventures and the licensing of new businesses.

titles.title: To provide OPIC insurance, reinsurance, and financing to eligible projects in Poland.
